intro: Siphonacanthus diffusus, commonly known as the spreading siphonacanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
